oberon-doc.summary: Commands can have more than one argument.
oberon-doc.p: Commands can have more than one argument. If just one argument is expected, any embedded , characters are ignored, like in sample1, sample2. Otherwise, the , is interpreted as an argument separator. For example, the @uref command can have up to three arguments: URL, URLTEXT, or URLTEXTREPLACEMENT. Additional , are considered part of the last argument, but are removed: URLTEXTREPLACEMENT1 REPLACEMENT2.
